ARABIC: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Shall I tell you upon whom the shaytans descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Should I tell you on whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: O people, shall I tell you on whom it is that satans descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Should I tell you to whom the satans come?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Shall I inform you upon whom do the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Shall I inform you upon whom the Shayatin descend
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Shall I inform you (of him) upon whom the Shaitans descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Shall I tell you on whom the Satans come down?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Shall I tell you upon whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Shall declare unto you upon whom the satans descend!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Should I inform you on whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Shall I inform you, (O people!), on whom it is that the evil ones descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Shall I inform you (O people!) upon whom the Shayatin (devils) descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Shall I tell you on whom the satans descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:221] Shall I inform you, O disbelievers of Mecca, upon whom the devils descend? (tanazzalu: one of the tā’ letters in the original [tatanazzalu] has been omitted).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend) with fortune telling?
